issue.description: In file xsl/ap_docs/sect_1_scope.xsl Need to check to check whether there are any notes in the inscope statements, if so the note to the AAM will need to be numbered.
Need to delete xsl/projmg and migrate everything to xsl/projmg
Need to add normative references to implementation methods - these should be auto generated.

comment.description: Appears to be fixed.

issue.description: Need to add changes summary section to introduction and create a new annex for detailed change information.

comment.description:
The foreword contains boilerplate about the edition The introduction contains summary of changes Last Annex contains details of changes
Need to check whether there is any boilerplate required for the last Annex

issue.description: Need to sort out numbering of annexes
Need to create ballot generation build Need to add dependent modules
Check default norm refs and abbrevs
Check issues dtd
The boilerplate in the introductions needs work.
Need to include the shortnames from the irs
check the spacing in the bibliography entry Add the IDEF reference to the standard bibliography.
change AIM abbrev to MIM
Change the column order of the short names.

check the boilerplate text in annex Implementation method specific requirements The implementation method defines what types of exchange behaviour are required with respect to this part of ISO 10303. Conformance to this part of ISO 10303 shall be realized in an exchange structure. The file format may be encoded according to either the syntax and EXPRESS language mapping defined in ISO 10303-, ISO 10303-21 or ISO 10303-28 and in the MIM referenced in A.2 of this part of ISO 10303.
In introduction, change "A graphical presentation of the MIM is provided in annex . " to A graphical presentation of the MIM is provided in annex ??
<clause_ref> Needs to be extended to link to Conformance classes, activities and icoms.

comment.description: Modified <clause_ref> To reference an activity use linkend: linkend="aam:activity:activity_id" To reference an icom use linkend: linkend="aam:icom:icom_id" To reference a conformance class linkend: linkend="conformance:cc:cc_id"

issue.description: The title of the Technical Discussion annex is not being displayed.

comment.description: Corrected

description.p: The links provided for the EXPRESS expanded listings for the ARM and for the MIM both point to the ARM longform file.
Add MIM longform in the link.

comment.description: Corrected

issue.description: The final paragraph of the Introduction to the AP refers to <clause_ref linkend="fundamentals"/>. This is not being displayed.

comment.description: Corrected.

issue.description: In Annex A of the AP document, it states that "The ARM EXPRESS expanded listing for this part of ISO 10303 is provided in Annex E of the AP module," The link to Annex E is to the EXPRESS, not the Annex. The XSL should be fixed.

comment.description: Corrected the links

description.p: Third sentence: The words "may" and "either" are not acceptable here. Normative definitions are needed on how to implement this part of ISO 10303.

Change the sentence to: "The file format shall be encoded according to either the syntax and EXPRESS language mapping defined in ISO 10303-21 and in the MIM referenced in A.2 of this part of ISO 10303.
The wording should be: "The file format shall be encoded according to the syntax and EXPRESS language mapping defined in ISO 10303-21 and in the MIM referenced in A.2 of this part of ISO 10303."

issue.description: If an AP contains an explicit bibliography element the XSL pulls in the default bibliography for the modules (stepmod/data/basic/bibliography_default.xml) instead of (stepmod/data/basic/ap_doc/bibliography_default.xml)

comment.description: Corrected XSL in stepmod/xsl/ap_doc/sect_biblio.xsl

issue.description:
Need to refer to: [1] IEEE Std 1320.1-1998, Standard for Functional Modeling Language  Syntax and Semantics for IDEF0, 1998.
[3] Guidelines for the content of application modules, ISO TC184/SC4/N1686, 2004-02-27.

comment.description: stepmod/data/basic/ap_doc/bibliography_default.xml

issue.description: Annex D According to the SD, the title of this annex should be "Protocol Implementation Conformance Statement (PICS) proforma," not "Protocol Implementation Conformance Statement (PICS) form."

comment.description: According to Guidelines for the content of application protocols that use application modules, ISO TC184/SC4/N1686, 2004-02-25." It should be "D Protocol Implementation Conformance Statement (PICS) form" Which is correct?
On instructions from QC + Convener + SC4 chair - changed to proforma

issue.description: The items in the bibliography are not numbered sequentially.

comment.description: Corrected.

issue.description:
The HTML Guidelines say:
The editor shall provide an HTML page containing a list of files, in sequence, with hyperlinks, that can be printed in order obtain a complete printout of the document.
Where is that page?

comment.description: Asked for clarification.

issue.description: Files iso10303_221/data/application_protocols/functional_data_and_their_schematic_representation_for_process_plant/sys/index_arm_mapping_inner.htm and index_mim_express_inner.htm seem to have a lot of bad links--discovered with LinkVerify (http://link-verify.sourceforge.net/index.en.html); unfortunately, it does not allow me to copy and paste the error log into this document. This is an HTML generation issue and will be fixed when the document is finally built for ballot. I'm not sure what you mean by "finally built for ballot." Every version that you sent me should be an attempt to meet the requirements for ballot. Error 1 One error seems to be with backslashes in names. An example of the error is the on line 469 of iso10303_221/data/application_protocols/functional_data_and_their_schematic_representation_for_process_plant/sys/index_arm_mappings_inner.htm: This is supposed to link to: on line 581 of iso10303_221/data/modules/functional_data/sys/5_mapping.htm. Clause 6.2 of the HTML 4.01 specification (http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/types.html#h-6.2) says: ID and NAME tokens must begin with a letter ([A-Za-z]) and may be followed by any number of letters, digits ([0-9]), hyphens ("-"), underscores ("_"), colons (":"), and periods. So it would appear that backslashes are not allowed.

comment.description: replaced the \ with /

issue.description:
The files *expg*.htm have a link to "#map", but there is no anchor by that name in the files. This is an HTML generation issue and will be fixed when the document is finally built for ballot. An example is in iso10303_221/data/application_protocols/functional_data_and_their_schematic_representation_for_process_plant/aamidef0 where we find:
I don't see anything wrong with this. http://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_map.asp says: Note: The usemap attribute in refers to the id or name (browser dependant) attribute in , therefore we have added both the id and name attributes to . It appears that LinkVerify is looking for an ID attribute on the MAP element Would you mind adding the ID attribute to the MAP element (with the same value as the NAME attribute) to try to get those errors to go away?

comment.description: Added ID to map as requested.

issue.description:
Another error is a mismatch of capitalization of names. For example iso10303_221/data/application_protocols/functional_data_and_their_schematic_representation_for_process_plant/sys/index_mim_express_inner.htm has:
<a href="../../../modules/cardinality_of_relationship/mimexpg2.htm" target="info">
but line 156 of iso10303_221/data/modules/cardinality_of_relationship/sys/5_mim.htm has:
<a name="cardinality_of_relationship_mim.relationship_select">
Clause 12.2.1 of the HTML 4.01 specification (http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/struct/links.html#h-12.2.1) says:
Anchor names must observe the following rules:
" Uniqueness: Anchor names must be unique within a document. Anchor names that differ only in case may not appear in the same document. " String matching: Comparisons between fragment identifiers and anchor names must be done by exact (case-sensitive) match.

comment.description: This seems only to be a problem in index_mim_express_inner.xsl where it has been corrected.

issue.description: The table of contents is missing the level 2 entries for Annexes A, C, D and E.

comment.description: Corrected

The Supplementary Directives say:
4.1.3 Table of contents
....Except for ISO 10303 application protocols and abstract test suites, the table of contents shall contain entries to the second level of subclause (to the subsubclause level) of the document....
9.1 Documentation of the table of contents
The table of contents of an AP shall follow the guidelines outlined in 4.1.3. The table of contents for an AP shall contain entries to the second level (the first subclause level) except for the units of functionality areas. The table of contents shall contain entries to the third level for the units of functionality (subclauses 4.1.1 4.1.n of the AP).
Table 11 of the SD shows annexes F.1 and F.2 being listed in the TOC.
The Guidelines for the content of application protocols that use application modules says:
4.1 Contents
Requirements for the Contents are unchanged in the modular architecture, with the exception that the AP-specific clauses vary as shown in Figure 2.
The current version of AP 221 has the TOC expanded down to 3 levels for annex F (it should only be 2, in accordance with the above), so why would you not expand the TOC to 2 levels for other annexes as well?
Changed table of contents in the main window to conform to above.

issue.description: Annex E Information object registration only lists the short form schemas. Need to include the long form schemas as well.

comment.description: Corrected

issue.description: The abbreviations should be listed in alphabetical order

Advised by email from Richard Cook ISO From: Cook [mailto:cook@iso.org] Sent: 04 November 2004 16:11 Subject: RE: AP239 modules 6. As we mentioned previously, the document reference within the abstract should read "ISO/TS 10303-xxxx:2004".

comment.description: Which part of the abstract are you referring to? (I have attached on for reference) Is it <TITLE>ISO/TS 10303-1241:2004 Information rights</TITLE> or This part of ISO 10303 specifies the application module Information rights. Richard's reply: The latter, i.e. in the BODY.

Changed so that the abstract does not say: "This part of ISO 10303" Instead: ISO/TS 10303-1248:2004 specifies the application module Product breakdown.
The following are within the scope of ISO/TS 10303-1248:2004:

issue.description:
Advised by email from Richard Cook ISO From: Cook [mailto:cook@iso.org] Sent: 04 November 2004 16:11 Subject: RE: AP239 modules
5. The Terms, definitions and abbreviations clause does not use the standard ISO text: "For the purposes of this part of ISO 10303, ..." is used instead of "For the purposes of this document, ...".

comment.description: Corrected

Advised by email from Mike Gibson ISO From: Gibson [gibson@iso.org] Sent: Tue 09/11/2004 11:03 Subject: RE: AP239 modules 4. We notice that you have changed the introductory text in the Terms and definitions as requested (from "For the purposes of this part of ISO 10303..." to "For the purposes of this document...") , but only from 3.5 onward. Could you make the same change for all subclauses?

issue.description: Backslashes in names. An example of the error is the on line 469 of iso10303_221/data/application_protocols/functional_data_and_their_schematic_representation_for_process_plant/sys/index_arm_mappings_inner.htm: This is supposed to link to: on line 1575 of iso10303_221/data/modules/functional_data/sys/5_mapping.htm. But the latter has backslashes instead of forward slashes. *sClause 6.2 of the HTML 4.01 specification (http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/types.html#h-6.2) says: ID and NAME tokens must begin with a letter ([A-Za-z]) and may be followed by any number of letters, digits ([0-9]), hyphens ("-"), underscores ("_"), colons (":"), and periods. So it would appear that neither backslashes nor forward slashes allowed.

comment.description: I have changed the <a name where a mapping entry contains SELF\ to self. This is a change to xsl/sect_5_mapping.xsl and xsl/apd_doc/index_arm_mappings_inner.xsl

issue.description: D.1 Protocol implementation identification "ISO PAS implementation name" Why "PAS"? This document is a TS. In any case, why refer to the document type in this question?

comment.description: Removed the PAS

issue.description:
B MIM short names The list is not in alphabetical order. For example, you have:
pre_defined_curve_font PDCF ISO 10303-46 product_definition_formation_relationship PDFR ISO 10303-41 pre_defined_text_font PDTF ISO 10303-46

comment.description: Now sorted according to entity name - not shortform name

issue.description: 3.2 Terms defined in Standard number missing. 3.3 Terms defined in Standard number missing.

comment.description: Corrected year of pub for 202 and 1001 in normrefs_defaults to agree with normrefs

issue.description:
Meta Data The files have the following line: <META name="DC.Identifier" content="ISO TC184/SC4/WG12 N1582">
It should be WG12, not WG3. Also, please replace the " " with an ordinary space.
A similar comment applies to the modules.

comment.description: Fixed module and or ap stylesheets

issue.description:
<META name="DC.Dates" content="2004/12/10 19:20:39">
Use the ISO format for the date, e.g., "2004-12-04". See SC4 Resolution 457.
A similar comment applies to the modules.

comment.description: Fixed module and or ap stylesheets
